item.title: CENTER TANK FUEL PUMPS – AIRPLANES WITHOUT AUTOMATIC SHUT OFF SYSTEM

numlitem.para: Boeing Alternative Method of Compliance to Airworthiness Directives 2002-19-52 and 2002-24-51 (Operations Manual Bulletin Center Tank Fuel Pumps) is in effect,
Center tank is verified to contain less than 5,000 pounds (2,300 kg) of fuel,
Center tank fuel is not used, and

note.para: Aircraft does not have Automatic Shut OFF system installed – (Restriction placard installed).
BOTH pumps are INOP for this sequence.

numlitem.para: The aircraft's ZFW (Basic Operating Weight and payload) plus center tank fuel weight may not exceed 200,000 lbs.
Center Tank fuel quantity must be considered unusable.

placard.para: Placard BOTH Center Fuel Pump Switches "PUMP INOP – C/B PULLED ON P6" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: To determine Center Tank Fuel quantity, observe the fuel quantity on the Fuel Quantity Indicator (P5) or the Fueling Control Panel (P28).

note.para: Suction Defuel of Center Tank is not permitted.

numlitem.para: Open and collar both Center Tank OVRD pump C/B's on P6:
